meanings.definition: A substance used to add color to something.
meanings.sent1: The artist mixed the red colourant with the paint to create a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a blue colourant to the frosting to make the cake more visually appealing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child accidentally spilled the yellow colourant all over the kitchen table.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a colourant that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with its natural colourant, creating a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: A material that changes the color of another substance.
meanings.sent1: The hair colourant transformed her brown hair into a vibrant shade of red.
meanings.sent2: The fabric colourant turned the white shirt into a beautiful shade of pink.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy scientist accidentally spilled the colourant, turning the lab rat purple.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a colourant, changing her mood from sad to happy.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion worked like a colourant, altering the appearance of the old book into a new one.
